mapper.select: select o.orderid,o.username,o.storeid,o.totalprice,o.datee,o.userid,t.foodid,t.orderid,t.orderdetailid, f.foodid,f.foodname,f.price,f.picpath from fooddetail f,orderdetail t,orderblm o where t.foodid=f.foodid and t.orderid=o.orderid and o.userid=#{userid}
mapper.sql: orderid, userid, username, storeid, foodid, foodname, totalprice, datee, isvalid, remarks
mapper.insert: insert into orderblm (orderid, userid, username, storeid, foodid, foodname, totalprice, datee, isvalid, remarks) values (#{orderid,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{userid,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{storeid,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{foodid,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{foodname,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{totalprice,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{datee,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{isvalid,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{remarks,jdbcType=VARCHAR})

mapper.update:
update orderblm
userid = #{userid,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
username = #{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
storeid = #{storeid,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
foodid = #{foodid,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
foodname = #{foodname,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
totalprice = #{totalprice,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
datee = #{datee,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
isvalid = #{isvalid,jdbcType=INTEGER},
remarks = #{remarks,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where orderid = #{orderid,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
